member.name: T:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Connect_Rsc
member.summary: Establishes a user session with Rubrik Security Cloud
member.description: The Connect-Rsc Cmdlet is used to connect to the Rubrik Security Cloud (RSC) API. RSC then returns a unique token to represent the user's credentials for subsequent calls. The token is stored securly in a .NET object within this PowerShell session. The recommended authentication method is a Rsc Service Account. Service Account credentials may be provided as parameters, or stored in an encrypted credential file, using Set-RscServiceAccountFile. Service Account .json files (unencryped) are not supported.
member.example: Connect to Rubrik Security Cloud, using the URL, Client Id and Client Secret Connect-Rsc -Server mycompany.my.rubrik.com -ClientId xxxxxxxxx -ClientSecret xxxxxxxxx

Connect to Rubrik Security Cloud, using a service account file, stored in the default RSC credential store in the user profile The service account file can be downloaded from the Rsc Web UI.
Set-RscServiceAccountFile -InputFilePath rubrik_service_account.json Connect-Rsc

Connect to Rubrik Security Cloud, using a service account file, stored in a location other than the default RSC credential store. The service account file can be downloaded from the Rsc Web UI.
Set-RscServiceAccountFile -InputFilePath rubrik_service_account.json -OutputFilePath rubrik_service_account.xml Connect-Rsc -ServiceAccountFile rubrik_service_account.xml

Connect to Rubrik Security Cloud, using a service account file, stored in a location held in the OS environment variable RSC_SERVICE_ACCOUNT_FILE The service account file can be downloaded from the Rsc Web UI.
Set-RscServiceAccountFile -InputFilePath rubrik_service_account.json -OutputFilePath $ENV:RSC_SERVICE_ACCOUNT_FILE Connect-Rsc -FromEnv

member.name: P:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Connect_Rsc.FromEnv
member.summary: Use a service account, which path is stored in an environment variable

member.name: P:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Connect_Rsc.ServiceAccountFile
member.summary: Used to specify the service account file downloaded from Rubrik Security Cloud

member.name: P:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Connect_Rsc.Server
member.summary: FQDN or the Rubrik Security Cloud Instance. I.e. mycompany.my.rubrik.com This can also be found in the JSON file downloaded from RSC when creating the Service Account

member.name: P:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Connect_Rsc.ClientId
member.summary: The Service Account ClientId. This can be found as "client_id" in the JSON file downloaded from RSC when creating the Service Account

member.name: P:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Connect_Rsc.ClientSecret
member.summary: The Service Account ClientSecret in SecureString format. The ClientSecret can be found as "client_secret" in the JSON file downloaded from RSC when creating the Service Account Convert the JSON plain text field into a secure string with: $secret = $(Get-Content service_account_file.json | ConvertFrom-Json).client_secret | ConvertTo-SecureString -AsPlainText

member.name: T:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Get_RscCmdlet
member.description: Look up a GraphQL Operation and return info about the cmdlet that implements it.
member.example:
Retrieve the name of the cmdlet that implements the GraphQL query clusterConnection
PS> Get-RscCmdlet clusterConnection

Retrieve info for a GraphQL operation that is not implemented by a cmdlet.
PS> Get-RscCmdlet notImplementedOperation

member.name: P:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Get_RscCmdlet.ExistingGqlRootFieldName
member.summary: The name of the GraphQL Operation to look up.

member.name: P:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Get_RscCmdlet.AnyGqlRootFieldName
member.summary: The name of the GraphQL Operation to look up.

member.name: P:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Get_RscCmdlet.Locations
member.summary: Info about the various locations the SDK uses

member.name: T:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Get_RscFileset
member.summary: Retrieve one or more filsets managed by Rubrik Security Cloud (Rsc).
member.description: The Get-RscFileset cmdlet is used to get one or more filesets known to RSC. The -FilesetId parameter will return a single fileset. All other parameters will return a list of matching filesets. When -FilesetId is NOT specified, -HostId is required. -HostId can accept a value from the pipeline
member.example: Get a list of all filesets on a specified host Get-RscFileset -HostId xxxxx-xxxxx-xxxxx-xxxxx
Get a list of all filesets on a specified host, filtered by name Get-RscFileset -HostId xxxxx-xxxxx-xxxxx-xxxxx -Name etc
Get a list of all filesets on a host, providing the host via the pipeline Get-RscHost -OsType Linux -First 1 | Get-RscFileset

member.name: P:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Get_RscFileset.HostId
member.summary: The Id of the Physical Host to get filesets for

member.name: P:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Get_RscFileset.First
member.summary: Return only the fist # of results

member.name: P:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Get_RscFileset.FilesetId
member.summary: Get a fileset using its ID

member.name: T:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Get_RscFilesetTemplate
member.summary: Retrieve one or more filset templates managed by Rubrik Security Cloud (Rsc).
member.description: The Get-RscFileset cmdlet is used to get one or more fileset templates known to RSC. The -Id parameter will return a template. All other parameters will return a list of matching templates. Returns Windows and Linux fileset templates.
member.example: Get a list of all Linux fileset templates. Get-RscFilesetTemplate -OsType Linux
Get a list of Windows fileset templates, matching a name pattern. Get-RscFilesetTemplate -OsType Windows -Name myWinTemplate
Get a template by Id, with default fields selected. Get-RscFilesetTemplate -Id 76254be7-baa4-5145-a4b7-a7a7773ad97d

member.name: P:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Get_RscFilesetTemplate.OsType
member.summary: Operating system type of fileset templates to return. Valid values are: "Windows" and "Linux".

member.name: P:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Get_RscFilesetTemplate.First
member.summary: Return only the fist # of results

member.name: P:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Get_RscFilesetTemplate.Id
member.summary: Get a physical host using its ID

member.name: P:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Get_RscFilesetTemplate.Field
member.summary: Activate selected fields based on not-null properties of the input fields object

member.name: T:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Get_RscHost
member.summary: Retrieve one or more physical hosts managed by Rubrik Security Cloud (Rsc).
member.description: The Get-RscHost cmdlet is used to get one or more physical hosts known to RSC. The -Id parameter will return a single host. All other parameters will return a list of matching hosts.
member.example: Get a list of all Linux from the RSC instance. Get-RscHost -OsType Linux
Get a list of Windows Hosts, matching a name pattern. Get-RscHost -OsType Windows -Name myWindowsServer
Get a host by Id, with default fields selected. Get-RscHost -Id 76254be7-baa4-5145-a4b7-a7a7773ad97d

member.name: P:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Get_RscHost.OsType
member.summary: Operating system type of hosts to return. Valid values are "Windows" and "Linux".

member.name: P:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Get_RscHost.First
member.summary: Return only the fist # of results

member.name: P:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Get_RscHost.Relics
member.summary: Include only items that are relics

member.name: P:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Get_RscHost.Replicated
member.summary: Include only items that are replicated

member.name: P:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Get_RscHost.Id
member.summary: Get a physical host using its ID

member.name: P:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Get_RscHost.Field
member.summary: Activate selected fields based on not-null properties of the input fields object

member.name: T:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Get_RscMssqlDatabase
member.summary: Retrieve one or more Mssql Databases managed by Rubrik Security Cloud (Rsc).
member.description: The Get-RscMssqlDatabase cmdlet is used to get one or more Mssql DBs known to RSC. The -Id parameter will return a single DB. All other parameters will return a list of matching DBs.
member.example: Get a list of all Mssql DBs from the RSC instance. Get-RscMssqlDatabase
Get a list of Mssql DBs, matching a name pattern. Get-RscMssqlDatabase -Name devVM
Get a Mssql DB by Id, with default fields selected. Get-RscMssqlDatabase -Id 76254be7-baa4-5145-a4b7-a7a7773ad97d

Get a Mssql DB by Id, with custom fields selected (Id, Name)
$myFields = Get-RscType -Name MssqlDatabase -InitialFields @("Id","Name") Get-RscMssqlDatabase -Id 76254be7-baa4-5145-a4b7-a7a7773ad97d -Fields $myFields

member.name: P:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Get_RscMssqlDatabase.Id
member.summary: Retrieve a single Mssql Database by Id

member.name: P:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Get_RscMssqlDatabase.Fields
member.summary: An object to use as a field selector for the query. Values from the API for fields set to not-null values in this object will be returned.

member.name: T:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Get_RscSnapshot
member.summary: Retrieves all of the snapshots (backups) for any given object
member.description: The Get-RscSnapshot cmdlet is used to query the RSC instance for all known snapshots (backups) for a protected object. Multiple objects to be piped into this function is not yet supported
member.example: Get the snapshot list for an object by the object Id Get-RscSnapshot -Id 'xxxxxx-xxxxx-xxxxxx-xxxxx'

Get the snapshots for vSphere VM from pipeline
$vm = Get-RscVsphereVm -Id xxxxxx-xxxxxx-xxxxxx-xxxxxx $vm | Get-RscSnapshot

member.name: P:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Get_RscSnapshot.SnappableId
member.summary: The ID of the snappable object to get a list of snapshots for.

member.name: P:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Get_RscSnapshot.First
member.summary: Return only the first # of results

member.name: P:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Get_RscSnapshot.SnapshotId
member.summary: Retreive a single CDM snapshot by ID. PolarisSnapshot is not yet supported.

member.name: P:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Get_RscSnapshot.ClusterUUID
member.summary: Ensure that the snapshot returned belongs to a specific CDM Cluster.

member.name: T:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Get_RscType
member.summary: Return a valid empty .NET object for the RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell SDK
member.description:
Return a valid empty .NET object for the RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell SDK.
The cmdlet will return a .NET object by name. The -ListAvailable parameter will return a list of valid RubrikSecurityCloud.Types.
member.example:
Get a list of all available Rsc .NET types
PS C:\> Get-RscType -ListAvailable

Get a list of available Rsc .NET types filtered by name
PS C:\> Get-RscType -ListAvailable -FilterByName "accountsetting"

Get an empty object that is compliant with the Rsc Type specified by name
PS C:\> Get-RscType -Name "AccountSetting"

Get an empty object that is compliant with the Rsc Type specified by name. Initialize the 'IsEulaAccepted' property
PS C:\> Get-RscType -Name "AccountSetting" -InitialProperties @("IsEulaAccepted")

Get an empty object that is compliant with the Rsc Type specified by name. Initialize the 'IsEulaAccepted' property with a specific value.
PS C:\> Get-RscType -Name "AccountSetting" -InitialValues @{"IsEulaAccepted"= $false}

Get a list of all available Rsc .NET Interfaces
PS C:\> Get-RscType -ListAvailable -Interfaces

Get a list of all available Rsc .NET Interfaces filtered by name
PS C:\> Get-RscType -ListAvailable -Interfaces -FilterByName "mssql"

Get a list of all Rsc .NET types that implement the MssqlTopLevelDescendantType interface
PS C:\> Get-RscType -Interface MssqlTopLevelDescendantType

member.name: P:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Get_RscType.Name
member.summary: The name of the Rsc Type to return

member.name: P:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Get_RscType.InitialProperties
member.summary: Specify an array of string containing the names of the properties to initialize.

member.name: P:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Get_RscType.InitialValues
member.summary: Specify a hashtable mapping the requested fields to their values.

member.name: P:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Get_RscType.ListAvailable
member.summary: Used to request a list of valid Rsc Type Names.

member.name: P:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Get_RscType.FilterByName
member.summary: Optional to filter results by name.

member.name: P:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Get_RscType.Interfaces
member.summary: Flag to specify if interfaces should be returned.

member.name: P:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Get_RscType.Interface
member.summary: Used to request a list of types implementing a given interface.

member.name: T:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Get_RscVersion
member.summary: Returns the Rubrik Security Cloud Server version, as well a the Rubrik Security Cloud PowerShell SDK schema version. Ideally these values should match for maximum SDK compatibility.

member.name: T:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Get_RscVsphereVm
member.summary: Retrieve one or more vSphere Virtual Machines (VMs) managed by Rubrik Security Cloud (Rsc).
member.description: The Get-RscVsphereVm cmdlet is used to get one or more vSphere VMs known to RSC. The -Id parameter will return a single VM. All other parameters will return a list of matching VMs.
member.example: Get a list of all vSphere VMs from the RSC instance. Get-RscVsphereVm
Get a list of vSphere VMs, matching a name pattern. Get-RscVsphereVm -Name devVM
Get a vSphere VM by Id, with default fields selected. Get-RscVsphereVm -Id 76254be7-baa4-5145-a4b7-a7a7773ad97d

Get a vSphere VM by Id, with custom fields selected (Id, Name, and GuestOsType).
$myFields = Get-RscType -Name VSphereVm $myFields.Id = "FETCH" $myFields.Name = "FETCH" $myFields.GuestOsType = "FETCH" Get-RscVsphereVm -Id 76254be7-baa4-5145-a4b7-a7a7773ad97d -Fields $myFields

member.name: P:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Get_RscVsphereVm.Id
member.summary: Retrieve a single known VM by Id

member.name: P:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Get_RscVsphereVm.Fields
member.summary: An object to use as a field selector for the query. Values from the API for fields set to not-null values in this object will be returned. To be used only with -Id parameter.

member.name: T:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Invoke_Rsc
member.summary: Send a custom GraphQL query to the Rubrik Security Cloud (RSC) API.
member.description: The passed query is sent to the Rubrik Security Cloud API, and the result is returned to the user.
member.example:
Read GraphQL query from txt file.
Get-Content -Path /Samples/GetVsphereVmList.query.txt -Raw | Invoke-Rsc

Read GraphQL query from parameter.
Invoke-Rsc -Query "mutation DeleteWebhookMutation(`$id: Int!) { deleteWebhook(input: {id: `$id}) }" -Variables @{id = 1}

member.name: P:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Invoke_Rsc.Query
member.summary: The GQL query to send to the Rubrik Security Cloud API.

member.name: P:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Cmdlets.Invoke_Rsc.Variables
member.summary: The variables to supply to the GraphQL query.

member.name: T:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Private.RscBasePSCmdlet
member.summary: Base class for all RSC PowerShell cmdlets.

member.name: M:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Private.RscBasePSCmdlet.#ctor
member.summary: Create a new RSC PowerShell cmdlet.

member.name: M:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Private.RscBasePSCmdlet.GetProfileDir
member.summary: Get the RSC SDK's user profile directory. Typically "$(Split-Path $PROFILE -Parent)/rubrik-powershell-sdk" But resolves to the current directory if $PROFILE is not defined.

member.name: M:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Private.RscBasePSCmdlet.GetValueFromParameterSet(System.String)
member.summary: If a cmdlet parameter exists with given name, within the current parameter set, return its value.

member.name: T:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Private.RscGqlPSCmdlet
member.summary: Base class for all RSC PowerShell cmdlets that use a GraphQL query.

member.name: P:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Private.RscGqlPSCmdlet.Input
member.summary: Specifies the inputs to the GraphQL operation. Any other -Op, -Var, or -Field parameter will override what is given in -Input.

member.name: P:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Private.RscGqlPSCmdlet.Op
member.summary: Operation to run. Overridden by operation switches. Only use -Op to programmatically pick the operation to run. Typically, you would use the operation switches instead. For example, `Invoke-RscQueryCluster -List` is equivalent to `Invoke-RscQueryCluster -Op List`.

member.name: P:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Private.RscGqlPSCmdlet.Arg
member.summary: Operation variables. DEPRECATED in favor of -Var

member.name: P:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Private.RscGqlPSCmdlet.Field
member.summary: An object that represents the fields that need to be returned for a given query. Each property on this object that does not have a null value (actual values don’t matter) will be included in the API request.

member.name: P:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Private.RscGqlPSCmdlet.Patch
member.summary: Patch the field spec with field names from a string

member.name: P:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Private.RscGqlPSCmdlet.PatchFile
member.summary: Patch the field spec with field names from a file

member.name: P:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Private.RscGqlPSCmdlet.GetInput
member.summary: Returns an object that contains the Op, Var and Field inputs that would be used to run the operation.

member.name: P:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Private.RscGqlPSCmdlet.InputProfile
member.summary: The field profile determines how inputs to the operation should be automatically set if they are not explicitly given as parameters. DEPRECATED in favor of -FieldProfile

member.name: P:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Private.RscGqlPSCmdlet.FieldProfile
member.summary: The field profile determines how inputs to the operation should be automatically set if they are not explicitly given as parameters.

member.name: P:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Private.RscGqlPSCmdlet.GetGqlRequest
member.summary: Returns the GraphQL request instead of sending it to the server.

member.name: M:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Private.RscGqlPSCmdlet.#ctor
member.summary: Create a new RSC PowerShell cmdlet.

member.param: e.g. "($first: Int,$after: String,$last: Int,$before: String,$filter: ClusterFilterInput,$sortOrder: SortOrder,$sortBy: ClusterSortByEnum)"

member.name: M:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Private.RscGqlPSCmdlet.BuildRequest(System.String)
member.param: GraphQL field specification e.g. "count { node { id name } }"

member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:RubrikSecurityCloud.PowerShell.Properties.Resources.Culture

member.name: M:RubrikSecurityCloud.JsonUtils.JsonReady(System.Object)
member.summary: Convert an object so that it can be serialized to JSON. - Handles basic types (string, int, etc.) by returning them as-is. - Unwrap PowerShell PSObjects. - RSC types pass through. - Hashtables and Enumerable types are recursively processed. - Defaults to ToString() on unrecognized types.

member.name: M:RubrikSecurityCloud.RscCmdletInput.GqlOperation
member.summary: The name of the underlying GQL operation.

The return type of the operation.
The field spec of the operation.

member.name: M:RubrikSecurityCloud.RscGqlOperation.Query
member.summary: Return the query for the API server.

member.name: T:RubrikSecurityCloud.RscGqlVars
member.summary: Variables to be used in a GraphQL query.

member.name: M:RubrikSecurityCloud.RscGqlVars.Set(System.Object,System.Tuple{System.String,System.String}[],RubrikSecurityCloud.GetOverrideValueForVarDelegate,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Set variables from various input types.
member.param: - If varDefs shows only 1 variable, and obj is not a hashtable, then obj is assumed to be the value of that variable. - If obj is a string, it is assumed to be a comma-separated list of key-value pairs. - Otherwise obj must be a hashtable. Values are converted to JSON-serializable types (RSC types are passed through as-is).
Variable definitions modify the variables in 3 ways: - look up overrides from the cmdlet's parameters - throw on missing required variables - for basic types, convert the value to the correct type
Used to look up overrides from the cmdlet's parameters.
if false, throw on missing required variables.

member.name: M:RubrikSecurityCloud.RscGqlVars.Info
member.summary: Return documentation links for the variables.

member.name: M:RubrikSecurityCloud.RscGqlVars.Example
member.summary: Return an example of how the variables can be initialized.

member.name: M:RubrikSecurityCloud.RscGqlVars.conformToVarDefs(RubrikSecurityCloud.GetOverrideValueForVarDelegate,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Variable definitions modify the variables in 3 ways: - look up overrides from the cmdlet's parameters - throw on missing required variables - for basic types, convert the value to the correct type
